[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-09-17 13:05:04.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ceilometer/commit/fc03a59111c42eb40a9f71a1735a6e0f5571111f', 'message': 'Add the extra parameter in the tooz dependency

THe ceilometer requirement is tooz[zake] and not only tooz:

commit_message:
Add the extra parameter in the tooz dependency

THe ceilometer requirement is tooz[zake] and not only tooz:

https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/requirements.txt#L36

if zake is not specified, it does not get installed and the dependency
gets lost

Change-Id: I764ed8841da8503d0763e167f1a7a43bca796b49
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ceilometer refs/changes/22/603122/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - tooz[zake]

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I48f3a2e330617ef4668683cb78ac31f7e095a8ac
Story: #2002586
Task: #24341

commit_message:
Fix available roles listing

This change updates the expression which filters roles by role_tags.
In case when there are no role_tags defined in plan-environment.ymal
The expression should return all available roles

Closes-Bug: 1784605
Change-Id: I81051b0321c42c1b02974c5de310de88fb1a9d8b
(cherry picked from commit d83b4bf14fb900b4927f5b64ff4fe876174027d1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/71/602371/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: available_roles: <% let(root => $, roles => yaml_parse($.available_yaml_roles.join("\n"))) -> ($root.role_tags = null and $roles or $roles.where($root.role_tags.toSet().intersect($.get(tags, []).toSet()))) %>

commit_message:
Deprecate unused image_service parameter

As we have already started using python-glanceclient
instead of old glance client, deprecating unused
image_service parameter in nova.conf

The image_service parameter was removed from nova in
change Iea6db7898328a9060fb88586e042efbc0a4351fc

Change-Id: I9b80bf263695d34232056ca8b950eff7e5267ee7
(cherry picked from commit b9bb76c089472a42ed846b97a2137b8de4fdda60)

commit_message:
Prometheus: Fix Prometheus endpoints in apache config

This updates the endpoints in the apache configuration for
Prometheus to correctly define the file used for http basic auth
to validate the admin user. The Prometheus endpoints restricted to
the admin user specified file for the authbasicprovider, but did
not provide the file used for validating the user. This adds the
file correctly

Change-Id: I8561281236fb1efa2e51af342e30314aae8e5285

commit_message:
pass useStoryboard to logABug

The useStoryboard variable is being defined but was not being passed
to logABug. It may have been working as a global, but it is more clear
as an argument to the function, so pass it in.

Change-Id: I554b6089c9d3cbfb216108a051de835d3cd449a4
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
ensure repository_name is always set

The repository_name variable wasn't being set in the context, so the
bug link function was failing with an error due to the undefined
variable because the JS variable repositoryName was only conditionally
being created.

Change-Id: I0dccbfe7f02e6fb93ddab4d79cba5d2e9d2d543e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstackdocstheme refs/changes/29/603129/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: {%- if repository_name %} var repositoryName = "{{ repository_name }}"; {%- endif %}

subject: Prevent wheel builds using the existing mirror
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-09-17 09:53:42.000000000', 'files': ['roles/build-wheels/tasks/main.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/21f53396b78a3a54afd6e7fbcfb3b9bfcdc3be07', 'message': "Prevent wheel builds using the existing mirror

I think we have a situation where a wheel build has somehow put a
corrupt wheel into our mirrors, but the next run seems to grab the
corrupt wheel from the mirror again ...

Remove the wheel mirror from the pip configuration before starting the
build so we're actually building directly from upstream, which is what
is intended.

Change-Id: Icb590e805d0d29130bff99335590d1d0f646e4e4
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent wheel builds using the existing mirror

I think we have a situation where a wheel build has somehow put a
corrupt wheel into our mirrors, but the next run seems to grab the
corrupt wheel from the mirror again ...

Remove the wheel mirror from the pip configuration before starting the
build so we're actually building directly from upstream, which is what
is intended.

Change-Id: Icb590e805d0d29130bff99335590d1d0f646e4e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/64/603064/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Prevent using existing wheel mirror lineinfile: path: /etc/pip.conf state: absent regexp: '^extra-index-url.*$'

commit_message:
Deprecate parameters that have been removed from cinder

Deprecate the following parameters, which were removed from cinder
during the Queens cycle [1],[2].

- glance_api_version
- nova_catalog_info
- os_privileged_user_name
- os_privileged_user_password
- os_privileged_user_tenant
- os_privileged_user_auth_url

[1] https://review.openstack.org/502190
[2] https://review.openstack.org/503596

Note: The Rocky backport does not remove the deprecated
cinder::api::nova_catalog_admin_info parameter. The parameter is
deprecated, but it cannot be removed in Rocky.

Closes-Bug: #1790217
Change-Id: I973563145dacc7bd2b1ee43daff9c84d30bf2732
(cherry picked from commit 3c634d2794ccefa9224b90393ee3e04b2ef99062)

}) end it_raises 'a Puppet::Error', /The os_privileged_user_password parameter is required when privileged_user is set to true/ end context 'without os_privileged_user_tenant' do let :params do commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I2911c7fc4c51d8d5ed8f53751fa157eb5500f963
Story: #2002586
Task: #24342

GATE CHECK for TripleO

This change is used to check the health of our stable branch gate jobs
in the most direct way possible, by running the real gates on a noop
change.

commit_message:
Fix typo in ansible's module name.

Typo in ansible's module name causes issue during upgrade:
  "reason": "no action detected in task. This often indicates
  a misspelled module name, or incorrect module path.

Change-Id: Ia7accc61337464e5242eccbc0d385327de993c5f
(cherry picked from commit 3a88c871b3b8ef8257bcc3b3457801fbc9ef1ec3)

subject: Clean up role tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-09-14 20:05:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone/commit/a4d2fb38f39e384564aafc335803bf5317679286', 'message': "Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'ssl' job, given that the person working on
   that is no longer doing so, and no-one else has picked up
   the work.
2. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it.

Change-Id: I67e0d8f4ab52449a80adb5c479faefbc83617025
(cherry picked from commit 4238d5a4f4705d8ca26d38becf0e8d2fa5f95c5f)

commit_message:
Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'ssl' job, given that the person working on
   that is no longer doing so, and no-one else has picked up
   the work.
2. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it.

Change-Id: I67e0d8f4ab52449a80adb5c479faefbc83617025
(cherry picked from commit 4238d5a4f4705d8ca26d38becf0e8d2fa5f95c5f)

commit_message:
Refactor DRY_RUN, STATS_* and COLLECT_CONF vars

The dry_run ansible var will not be defined by default,
only manually defined at reproducer and similar.

The STATS_ vars will be re-implemented after TOCI refactoring

This is part of the card [1]

[1] https://trello.com/c/AerVRkBH/887-replace-bash-environment-variables-in-tociquickstartsh-with-ansible-variables-from-zuul-inventory-or-zuul-job-config-s17?menu=filter&filter=label:Sprint%2017%20CI

Change-Id: Iaf0ba7e06c809859f8ad60070285941ec436b5e9

commit_message:
Add a note about deployment projects for upgrade-checkers goal

Deployment projects are not the primary focus nor a goal
for integration of the upgrade-checkers that get added
to service projects in Stein. This change adds a note about
deployment projects for the upgrade-checkers goal that while
those projects are not a target for the goal, integration
with them is obviously a good thing.

Change-Id: I2ba644d5d89331754bf2ff25e556b92b72024ee9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/35/599835/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note:: This goal is primarily focused on the traditional stateful service projects like keystone, cinder, glance, etc. However, deployment projects would clearly benefit from integrating these checks into their install and upgrade routines but that is not part of this goal in Stein since some of the service project checks might not even be complete until the end of Stein and thus not consumable to deployment projects until the "T" release at the earliest.

commit_message:
Replace toci ENV_VARS by ansible env_vars

This move the ENV_VARS to the different
environment_type yaml config files.

It also implements there the check if it's running in RDO,
to add the extra config for it.

Also note that RHCLOUD env variable has being removed,
and harcoded the use with "rdocloud".

This commit implement part of the task [1]

[1] https://trello.com/c/AerVRkBH/887-replace-bash-environment-variables-in-tociquickstartsh-with-ansible-variables-from-zuul-inventory-or-zuul-job-config-s17?menu=filter&filter=label:Sprint%2017%20CI

Change-Id: I96f0925a39ad37e0eb51de6900cf78dae2b5505b

commit_message:
Move featureset BASH variables to ansible

As part of the implementation of [1] we do the following:

It does the following move to ansible:
- FEATURESET_FILE -> common.yaml:job_featureset_file
- FEATURESET_CONF -> {{ environment_type }}.yaml:featurest_conf

Also add additional ansible variables:
- multinode_featureset_file: to point to tq featureset-multinode-common.yaml
- tripleo_quickstart_dir: to point to tq dir at tripleo_root
- common_featureset_conf to have the --extra-vars for the featurset_file

[1] https://trello.com/c/AerVRkBH/887-replace-bash-environment-variables-in-tociquickstartsh-with-ansible-variables-from-zuul-inventory-or-zuul-job-config-s17?menu=filter&filter=label:Sprint%2017%20CI

Change-Id: Ib1caf1261c6fd423a0bb4aa2be0f525bffd471bc

commit_message:
Move nodes_file and nodes_args to common.yaml

As part of [1] task, we do the following move
from toci bash environment variables:
- NODES_FILE -> common.yaml:nodes_file
- NODES_ARGS -> common.yaml:nodes_args

[1] https://trello.com/c/AerVRkBH/887-replace-bash-environment-variables-in-tociquickstartsh-with-ansible-variables-from-zuul-inventory-or-zuul-job-config-s17

Change-Id: I6e2a885113becf9085da93d46ea161b7570ce397

commit_message:
Add -W to sphinx-build invocation

With the new PTI interface, we build using tox -e docs. By default, we
should tread warnings as errors.

Add -W to sphinx-build everywhere where it's missing, some places had it
already, especially reference/project-testing-interface.rst.

Change-Id: Iec6f93fd45bc26d044197112c826cbaf83daca66
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/47/597047/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: commands = sphinx-build -E -W -b html doc/source doc/build

subject: SF ensure the correct volume is deleted
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-02 17:00:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/ec18163865c565db4d78169227a0f1203e29ea15', 'message': "SF ensure the correct volume is deleted

Author: Jay Rubenstein jay.rubenstein@netapp.com
Date: 2018-07-18 11:42 -0600

When two management systems are available openstack/cinder and
SolidFire-API/GUI  a volume can be deleted though either interface. Thus
if a volume is deleted through the SolidFire-interface and then again
through the openstack/cinder interface it was possible to delete another
volume.

The original code made an incorrect assumption on all the possible values returned
from a query to find the target volume. This could lead to deleting a
volume that was not the target of the original delete command from openstack/cinder.

The correction in the module _get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref  validates that the
returned object/volumes-id matchs the requested volume-id with a
comparison of svol['volumeID'] to int(sf_vid)

pep8 tabs to space changes

Closes-Bug: #1782373
Change-Id: I92a8e76c64c4e23dd185875e009132938ace5091

SF ensure volumes uuids match when volume found without a provider id

Change-Id: I19fd84e651a4c03376542b0d863f9f499fd01120

Refinement on the check to ensure we are deleting the correct volume
identified by either rvef.id a uuid or a volume id. We have verified
that these values are unique and non-null.

Closes-Bug: #1782373

SF add 4 unit tests for bug 1782373

When two management systems are available openstack/cinder and
SolidFire-API/GUI  a volume can be deleted though either interface. Thus
if a volume is deleted through the SolidFire-interface and then again

    another

    The original code made an incorrect assumption on all the possible

    volume that was not the target of the original delete command from
    openstack/cinder

This is a large change as  I ran pep8 formating on the file and it
shifted many lines that only change formatting

_get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref
_get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref_nomatch
_get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref_no_profile_id
_get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref_no_profile_id_nomatch

commit_message:
SF ensure the correct volume is deleted

Author: Jay Rubenstein jay.rubenstein@netapp.com
Date: 2018-07-18 11:42 -0600

When two management systems are available openstack/cinder and
SolidFire-API/GUI  a volume can be deleted though either interface. Thus
if a volume is deleted through the SolidFire-interface and then again
through the openstack/cinder interface it was possible to delete another
volume.

The original code made an incorrect assumption on all the possible values returned
from a query to find the target volume. This could lead to deleting a
volume that was not the target of the original delete command from openstack/cinder.

The correction in the module _get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref  validates that the
returned object/volumes-id matchs the requested volume-id with a
comparison of svol['volumeID'] to int(sf_vid)

pep8 tabs to space changes

Closes-Bug: #1782373
Change-Id: I92a8e76c64c4e23dd185875e009132938ace5091

SF ensure volumes uuids match when volume found without a provider id

Change-Id: I19fd84e651a4c03376542b0d863f9f499fd01120

Refinement on the check to ensure we are deleting the correct volume
identified by either rvef.id a uuid or a volume id. We have verified
that these values are unique and non-null.

Closes-Bug: #1782373

SF add 4 unit tests for bug 1782373

This is a large change as  I ran pep8 formating on the file and it
shifted many lines that only change formatting

There are also 4 new unit test:
_get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref
_get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref_nomatch
_get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref_no_profile_id
_get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref_no_profile_id_nomatch

Closes-bug: #1782373
Change-Id: Ib4904ffa411657573fa117fe4589e23a107385dd

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-09-10 15:10:58.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/solidfire/test_solidfire.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/98025728d0865a3ac8d35ce568f8d9445ebdad7e', 'message': "SF ensure the correct volume is deleted

Author: Jay Rubenstein jay.rubenstein@netapp.com
Date: 2018-07-18 11:42 -0600

When two management systems are available openstack/cinder and
SolidFire-API/GUI  a volume can be deleted though either interface. Thus
if a volume is deleted through the SolidFire-interface and then again
through the openstack/cinder interface it was possible to delete another
volume.

The original code made an incorrect assumption on all the possible values returned
from a query to find the target volume. This could lead to deleting a
volume that was not the target of the original delete command from openstack/cinder.

The correction in the module _get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref  validates that the
returned object/volumes-id matchs the requested volume-id with a
comparison of svol['volumeID'] to int(sf_vid)

identified by either rvef.id a uuid or a volume id. We have verified
that these values are unique and non-null.

commit_message:
SF ensure the correct volume is deleted

Author: Jay Rubenstein jay.rubenstein@netapp.com
Date: 2018-07-18 11:42 -0600

When two management systems are available openstack/cinder and
SolidFire-API/GUI  a volume can be deleted though either interface. Thus
if a volume is deleted through the SolidFire-interface and then again
through the openstack/cinder interface it was possible to delete another
volume.

The original code made an incorrect assumption on all the possible values returned
from a query to find the target volume. This could lead to deleting a
volume that was not the target of the original delete command from openstack/cinder.

The correction in the module _get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref  validates that the
returned object/volumes-id matchs the requested volume-id with a
comparison of svol['volumeID'] to int(sf_vid)

pep8 tabs to space changes

Closes-Bug: #1782373
Change-Id: I92a8e76c64c4e23dd185875e009132938ace5091

SF ensure volumes uuids match when volume found without a provider id

Change-Id: I19fd84e651a4c03376542b0d863f9f499fd01120

Refinement on the check to ensure we are deleting the correct volume
identified by either rvef.id a uuid or a volume id. We have verified
that these values are unique and non-null.

Closes-Bug: #1782373

SF add 4 unit tests for bug 1782373

here are also 4 new unit test:
_get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref
_get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref_nomatch
_get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref_no_profile_id
_get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref_no_profile_id_nomatch

Closes-bug: #1782373
Change-Id: Ib4904ffa411657573fa117fe4589e23a107385dd

SF clean spaces and over 80 character lines for newly added tests

Change-Id: Ic70c035252f140f086d501285568fdae2a3a9598

SF bug 1782373 implement reviewers suggestion to use get on array line 598
598             if sfv['attributes'].get('uuid',None) == vref.id:
Change-Id: I5dac23b55bdd480a5c80a54358edf5ad5d8acacf

commit_message:
Update PTI around docs build with additional logics

Additionally describes `publishdocs` environment which
can include PDF generation and translated docs build commands.

For PDFs, this patch explains how projects support PDF document
generation with xelatex dependency.

Note that the project infrastructure will support those stuff
by implementing progress with cross-project discussion [1].

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-docs-support-pdf-and-translation

Change-Id: I783f0b24121cc58fb7a47cdaa2eeff85930395c5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/10/588110/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - Generate PDF documentationAdditionally, projects can have a ``publishdocs`` environment set up in a ``tox.ini`` file to include the same command in ``docs`` environment and more commands for translated documents and PDF generation. To support PDF documentation generation, the projects should use PDF build support Sphinx plugins and the following command should work with ``xelatex`` environment and should result in a PDF file in ``doc/build/pdf``. .. code-block:: bash sphinx-build -b latex doc/source doc/build/pdf make -C doc/build/pdf

commit_message:
SF bug/1782588 add tests for extend with io scale feature
The scaling io by volume size was not implemented when a volume was
extened.   The original test for extend volume did not check for the
changed qos settings when a volume was extended.
Two modules where added.
fake_ext_qos_issue_api_request
test_extend_volume_with_scaled_qos
Change-Id: Ib1bee0329aae36cdbd0c924b9f8a891ec726a937

SF bug #1782588 failure to add scaled io when a volume is extended
the module _retrieve_qos_setting does all the work needed, by adding a
size value that has a default of 0 the module can be re-used and
called while extending a volume to get the qos settings.

Change-Id: I49b0e27496f8feff2e600d5b83c39cef5c50c634

Author: Jay Rubenstein jay.rubenstein@netapp.com

When two management systems are available openstack/cinder and
SolidFire-API/GUI  a volume can be deleted though either interface. Thus
if a volume is deleted through the SolidFire-interface and then again
through the openstack/cinder interface it was possible to delete another
volume.

The original code made an incorrect assumption on all the possible values returned
from a query to find the target volume. This could lead to deleting a
volume that was not the target of the original delete command from openstack/cinder.

The correction in the module _get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref  validates that the

comparison of svol['volumeID'] to int(sf_vid)

commit_message:
SF ensure the correct volume is deleted

Author: Jay Rubenstein jay.rubenstein@netapp.com
Date: 2018-07-18 11:42 -0600

When two management systems are available openstack/cinder and
SolidFire-API/GUI  a volume can be deleted though either interface. Thus
if a volume is deleted through the SolidFire-interface and then again
through the openstack/cinder interface it was possible to delete another
volume.

The original code made an incorrect assumption on all the possible values returned
from a query to find the target volume. This could lead to deleting a
volume that was not the target of the original delete command from openstack/cinder.

The correction in the module _get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref  validates that the
returned object/volumes-id matchs the requested volume-id with a
comparison of svol['volumeID'] to int(sf_vid)

pep8 tabs to space changes

Closes-Bug: #1782373
Change-Id: I92a8e76c64c4e23dd185875e009132938ace5091

SF ensure volumes uuids match when volume found without a provider id

Change-Id: I19fd84e651a4c03376542b0d863f9f499fd01120

Refinement on the check to ensure we are deleting the correct volume
identified by either rvef.id a uuid or a volume id. We have verified
that these values are unique and non-null.

Closes-Bug: #1782373

SF add 4 unit tests for bug 1782373

here are also 4 new unit test:
_get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref
_get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref_nomatch
_get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref_no_profile_id
_get_sfvol_by_cinder_vref_no_profile_id_nomatch

Closes-bug: #1782373
Change-Id: Ib4904ffa411657573fa117fe4589e23a107385dd

SF clean spaces and over 80 character lines for newly added tests

Change-Id: Ic70c035252f140f086d501285568fdae2a3a9598

commit_message:
Update PTI around project doc translation support

Describes how project documentation translation resources
such as po files are managed so that the project
infrastructure syncs po file(s) and builds translated documents.
The case of projects which need to manipulate pot file(s) [1]
(e.g., to exclude translation string targets) is also mentioned.

Note that the project infrastructure will support this stuff
by implementing progress with cross-project discussion [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543220/
[2] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-docs-support-pdf-and-translation

Change-Id: If7bb76fdd09b99a478cb67307019df01d0d0d1c4

added_lines: over the Internet. To that end, each project should support a consistent- Documentation translations import/export and merge - Generate translated documentation - Generate PDF documentationTo support documentation translations processing, documentation projects should locate pot and po files on ``doc/source/locale`` folder and ``doc/source/locale/$lang/LC_MESSAGES`` folder where $lang is ISO Language code managed by I18n team. For pot file manipulations, projects should make ``tools/doc-pot-filter.sh`` and describe how the projects manipulate pot file(s). To support PDF documentation generation, the following command should work with ``xelatex`` environment and should result in a PDF file in ``doc/pdf``. .. code-block:: bash sphinx-build -b latex doc/source doc/pdf make -C doc/pdf

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: If11afb223605f476996f5147a7e10dc0dfb8f00b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher-specs refs/changes/00/575100/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
Gate: only restart network manager if required

We only need to restart network manager if disabling dns management.

Change-Id: Idfdf68678a68c2808527de4226ff91e9ea5f8d67
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it.

Change-Id: I67e0d8f4ab52449a80adb5c479faefbc83617025
(cherry picked from commit 4238d5a4f4705d8ca26d38becf0e8d2fa5f95c5f)

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Id11e9dfb1ae9c987ea626cd115e970d26eae0882
Story: #2002586
Task: #24286

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Story: #2002586
Task: #24341

cni_ds_init: exec into the main process

container to be reported.

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

commit_message:
Set default ssl protocols according to used webserver

keystone currently uses two different webservers, depending on the
setup. Set the default ssl protocols accordingly.

Change-Id: If79fdb8d7bf0333bbcc24c42c5d7dc20476f9d64
Closes-Bug: 1770564

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000

Now that the v2.0 API has been removed, with Keystone v3
the admin (35357) and public (5000) ports are the same
and use the same keystone code paths for authentication.

This patch set replace 35357 and only uses port 5000

Change-Id: I1bc6f11892b7ec883210f0d9065a5b7d8f5cc246

added_lines: keystone_admin_port: 5000

commit_message:
Fix fluentd multifile problem.

There is a problem on the current implementation.
Currently the new_source variable is an Array of hashes,
not a hash of hashes. The current impletation is wrong,
as it can be seen for the following error at the log gate:
http://logs.openstack.org/09/563009/7/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode/aa4faf9/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud_deploy.log.txt.gz#_2018-09-03_15_17_39
[search for fluentd_service.pp] as there are too many lines at the same timestamp.

Error: Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Resource
Statement, Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function
Call, comparison of Hash with Hash failed at
/etc/puppet/modules/fluentd/manifests/config.pp:6:16  at
/etc/puppet/modules/tripleo/manifests/profile/base/logging/fluentd/fluentd_service.pp:47
on node centos-7-rax-iad-0001722758.localdomain

Change-Id: Ifd5fbf6509addf4a564ff83c4551525c9a139ff4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/85/601685/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context 'Multifiles -- horizon no transformation' do let(:params) { { :step => 4, :fluentd_default_format => '/(?<time>\\d{4}-\\d{2}-\\d{2} \\d{2} =>\\d{2}:\\d{2}.\\d+) (?<pid>\\d+) (?<priority>\\S+) (?<message>.*)$/', :fluentd_manage_groups => false, :fluentd_pos_file_path => '/var/cache/fluentd/', :service_names => [ 'horizon' ], } } it { is_expected.to contain_file('/etc/fluentd/config.d/100-openstack-horizon.conf').with_content ( "# This file is managed by Puppet, do not edit manually. <source> format /(?<time>\\d{4}-\\d{2}-\\d{2} \\d{2} =>\\d{2}:\\d{2}.\\d+) (?<pid>\\d+) (?<priority>\\S+) (?<message>.*)$/ path /var/log/horizon/test.log pos_file /var/cache/fluentd/horizon-test.pos tag openstack.horizon.test @type tail </source> <source> format /(?<time>\\d{4}-\\d{2}-\\d{2} \\d{2} =>\\d{2}:\\d{2}.\\d+) (?<pid>\\d+) (?<priority>\\S+) (?<message>.*)$/ path /var/log/horizon/access.log pos_file /var/cache/fluentd//openstack.horizon.access.pos tag openstack.horizon.access @type tail </source> " ) } end

commit_message:
Enable proxy header parsing

Ensure that oslo.middleware parses any proxy information
forwarded from haproxy/apache with regards to protocol;
this ensures that https connections are correctly detected.

Includes charm helper sync to bring in oslo middleware
template.

Change-Id: I1232d089ab91572ec31c1b2172881165097af5fb
Closes-Bug: 1758675

commit_message:
Add a guard to check for heat notify file

Sometimes after the execution of the script the heat notify file is not
present, this patch add a guard to check for it before extracting the
result code from it

Change-Id: Ibfcc945af97be9c56622144f0cb7307ffb215196
Closes-Bug: 1792343
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/72/602572/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: notify_file=/var/lib/heat-config/deployed/{{ deployment_uuid }}.notify.json retries=3 while [ ! -f $notify_file -a $retries -gt 0 ]; do sleep 1 retries=$(( $retries - 1 )) done exit $(jq .deploy_status_code $notify_file)

commit_message:
Replace assertEqual(True/False, *) with assertTrue/assertFalse in tests

In UT TestIt provides assertTrue(*) and assertFalse(*) to check the
returned value. It is not necessary to use assertEqual(True, *) or
assertEqual(False, *)

Change-Id: I335e5f542861c31ee5fa75953926e97701e50c77
Story: #2003776
Task: #26469
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector refs/changes/82/602582/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertTrue(wrote) self.assertTrue(wrote) self.assertFalse(wrote)
deleted_lines: self.assertEqual(True, wrote) self.assertEqual(True, wrote) self.assertEqual(False, wrote)

commit_message:
cni_ds_init: exec into the main process

This will make the right main process for the cni daemon
container to be reported.

Closes-Bug: 1792539

Change-Id: Ic57fbe20b7bf396ea92e0c2cbcca42814ae2a119

import zuul job settings from project-config

the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project

normalized.

  group's compute but still fit into the other compute

test.

commit_message:
Add [anti-]affinity tests that uses separate API requests

The test_create_server_with_scheduler_hint_group[_anti]_affinity test
cases used a single server create REST request to boot two servers with
[anti-]affinity. There is antoher possible scenarion when the two
servers are booted with two separate API requests.

This patch duplicates these tests and use the multi request senario in
the duplicates. The multi request scenarios expected to fail unitl the
bug 1746863 is fixed.

Parallel booting of servers with server groups can be racy. However the
currently proposed multi request tests are doing the server boot in
sequence and the second boot only started after the first server reached
ACTIVE state. At this point the first server already assigned to its
host so we expect that this cannot race with the second boot request.

The anti-affinity cases also extended to try to boot a third server that
expected to fail as there is only two computes in the multinode
environement. Similar extension is considered for the affinity case but
seems unfeasible in tempest. That extension for the affinity tests would
need to make the compute host having servers from the affinity group
undesirable as a scheduling target but keep the other compute desirable
(except for the affinity filter). This cannot be made without disturbing
other parallel running tempest test as either:
* the test needs to disable that compute
* the test needs to fill the compute with instances
* the test needs to create a flavor that is too big for the affinity
  group's compute but still fit into the other compute

So the extended affinity case needs to be covered in nova functional
test.

Change-Id: I120db36fa6e94cf02e46a770e5cae5e0444e89f3
Related-Bug: #1770434
Related-Bug: #1746863
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/49/581349/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: server1_uuid = self.create_test_server( scheduler_hints=hints, wait_until='ACTIVE')['id'] server2_uuid = self.create_test_server( scheduler_hints=hints, wait_until='ACTIVE')['id'] for server_id in [server1_uuid, server2_uuid]: self.assertIn(server_id, server_group['members']) hosts[server_id] = self._get_host(server_id) return hosts, group_id hosts, group_id = self._create_servers_with_group('anti-affinity') # create a third server and expect that it fails as we only have two # compute hosts self.create_test_server(scheduler_hints={'group': group_id}, wait_until='ERROR') hosts, group_id = self._create_servers_with_group('affinity')
deleted_lines: reservation_id = self.create_test_server( scheduler_hints=hints, wait_until='ACTIVE', min_count=2, return_reservation_id=True)['reservation_id'] # Get the servers using the reservation_id. servers = self.servers_client.list_servers( detail=True, reservation_id=reservation_id)['servers'] self.assertEqual(2, len(servers)) for server in servers: self.assertIn(server['id'], server_group['members']) hosts[server['id']] = self._get_host(server['id']) return hosts hosts = self._create_servers_with_group('anti-affinity') hosts = self._create_servers_with_group('affinity')

commit_message:
RedHat: Remove packages with conflict with MariaDB

Fixes the following problem since the upgrade to MariaDB 10.2

 file /usr/lib64/mysql/plugin/mysql_clear_password.so from install of MariaDB-common-10.2.17-1.el7.centos.x86_64 conflicts with file from package mariadb-common-3:10.1.20-2.el7.x86_64

Change-Id: I686ff5d70548f15a60f623e30b0b37fb0d525b8b

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I6d4f8add7a85eca76882ed0e767c1059c09bc559
Story: #2002586
Task: #24286

commit_message:
Revert "Drop opensuse-150 jobs"

This reverts commit 821a46800698ccf6b8fdca828eddf957751d15a8.

Finally, there are packages for Leap 15 for MariaDB 10.2 and 10.3
releases so we should be OK to restore the jobs so we can actually
test the Leap 15 distribution.

Change-Id: I24ed7198e1ae5e4af3084fea8477b6c102c7442e

commit_message:
Add support for cells v2

This change adds relations necessary for registering a compute cell
with the superconductor. For a cell to be registered this charm
must have relations with the compute cells conductor, database and
message queue. Only when all these relations are complete can the
registration happen. Below are major changes included in this PR.

* Add nova-cell-api relation for communicating with the
  nova-cell-conductor
* Add shared-db-cell relation for communicating with the
  a compute cells database.
* Add amqp-cell relation for communicating with the
  a compute cells message queue.
* Add methods for registering cells with the
  superconductors database.
* Charm helper sync

Change-Id: I9699fb3b52d8551817cb38cfeb747c5df78ba11d

commit_message:
Fix docs and add functional test for AggregateMultiTenancyIsolation

The docs for AggregateMultiTenancyIsolation were misleading in that
tenants are not restricted to hosts only in a tenant-isolated
aggregate. It's the opposite: hosts in the tenant-isolated aggregate
are only available for tenants configured for that aggregate.

This fixes the docs including an example for clarification, and also
adds a functional test to show the behavior of the filter.

Change-Id: Ic55b88e7ad21ab5b7ad063eac743ff9406aae559
Related-Bug: #1771523
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/35/601835/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils.fixture import uuidsentinel as uuids from nova import utils _image_ref_parameter = 'imageRef' _flavor_ref_parameter = 'flavorRef' api_major_version = 'v2.1' USE_NEUTRON = True def _setup_scheduler_service(self): # Add the AggregateMultiTenancyIsolation to the list of enabled # filters since it is not enabled by default. enabled_filters = CONF.filter_scheduler.enabled_filters enabled_filters.append('AggregateMultiTenancyIsolation') self.flags(enabled_filters=enabled_filters, group='filter_scheduler') return self.start_service('scheduler') def test_aggregate_multitenancy_isolation_filter(self): """Tests common scenarios with the AggregateMultiTenancyIsolation filter: * hosts in a tenant-isolated aggregate are only accepted for that tenant * hosts not in a tenant-isolated aggregate are acceptable for all tenants, including tenants with access to the isolated-tenant aggregate """ # Create a tenant-isolated aggregate for the non-admin user. user_api = self.useFixture( nova_fixtures.OSAPIFixture(self.api_major_version, project_id=uuids.non_admin)).api agg_id = self.api.post_aggregate( {'aggregate': {'name': 'non_admin_agg'}})['id'] meta_req = {'set_metadata': { 'metadata': {'filter_tenant_id': uuids.non_admin}}} self.api.api_post('/os-aggregates/%s/action' % agg_id, meta_req) # Start a second compute service and add it to the aggregate. fake.set_nodes(['host2']) self.addCleanup(fake.restore_nodes) self.start_service('compute', host='host2') host_req = {'add_host': {'host': 'host2'}} self.api.api_post('/os-aggregates/%s/action' % agg_id, host_req) # Stub out select_destinations to assert how many host candidates were # available per tenant-specific request. original_filtered_hosts = ( nova.scheduler.host_manager.HostManager.get_filtered_hosts) def spy_get_filtered_hosts(*args, **kwargs): self.filtered_hosts = original_filtered_hosts(*args, **kwargs) return self.filtered_hosts self.stub_out( 'nova.scheduler.host_manager.HostManager.get_filtered_hosts', spy_get_filtered_hosts) # Create a server for the admin - should only have one host candidate. server_req = self._build_minimal_create_server_request() server_req['networks'] = 'none' # requires microversion >= 2.37 server_req = {'server': server_req} with utils.temporary_mutation(self.api, microversion='2.37'): server = self.api.post_server(server_req) for x in range(10): server = self.api.get_server(server['id']) if server['status'] == 'ACTIVE': break time.sleep(.05) else: self.fail('Timed out waiting for server to be ACTIVE') # Assert it's not on host2 which is isolated to the non-admin tenant. self.assertNotEqual('host2', server['OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host']) self.assertEqual(1, len(self.filtered_hosts)) # Now create a server for the non-admin tenant to which host2 is # isolated via the aggregate, but the other compute host is a # candidate. We don't assert that the non-admin tenant server shows # up on host2 because the other host, which is not isolated to the # aggregate, is still a candidate. server_req = self._build_minimal_create_server_request() server_req['networks'] = 'none' # requires microversion >= 2.37 server_req = {'server': server_req} with utils.temporary_mutation(user_api, microversion='2.37'): server = user_api.post_server(server_req) for x in range(10): server = user_api.get_server(server['id']) if server['status'] == 'ACTIVE': break time.sleep(.05) else: self.fail('Timed out waiting for server to be ACTIVE') self.assertEqual(2, len(self.filtered_hosts))

commit_message:
Change monasca-collector service user and group to root

Starting monasca-collector service as root user will allow
to gather metrics from services which were started with root
privileges.

Change-Id: Ida453cc9e9f3f5a6bf4c69e007b7572665b6efbd
Story: 2003623
Task: 26467

added_lines: init_collector_service# This solution to fix problem with privileges for agent # to gather metrics from services started as root user. function init_collector_service { echo_summary "Init Monasca collector service" sudo systemctl stop monasca-collector sudo sed -i "s/User=mon-agent/User=root/g" /etc/systemd/system/monasca-collector.service sudo sed -i "s/Group=mon-agent/Group=root/g" /etc/systemd/system/monasca-collector.service sudo systemctl daemon-reload sudo systemctl restart monasca-collector }

commit_message:
Do not require port argument when updating floating IP

When setting floating ip other properties, port argument is
force to use.
The patch modifies the command, when setting floating ip other
properties, like tags, no need port argument.

Change-Id: I908712c8913f32d3dd5fdfefe7347277d72f66de
Story: 1751431
Task: 13865
Closes-Bug: #1778666
(cherry picked from commit 402c9a21b347509520be206e28ee7d0ef4004b92)
Small changes due to changes in tag handling and how unit tests are
working.

	doc/source/cli/command-objects/floating-ip.rst
	openstackclient/network/v2/floating_ip.py
	openstackclient/tests/unit/network/v2/test_floating_ip_network.py

commit_message:
Remove mysql-python

The mysql-python package is no longer maintained. We are using
pymysql instead, so this package does not need to be installed.

The tacker.conf file wasn't set to use pymysql, so we correct
that.

commit_message:
Remove mysql-python

The mysql-python package is no longer maintained. We are using
pymysql instead, so this package does not need to be installed.

The tacker.conf file wasn't set to use pymysql, so we correct
that.

Change-Id: I7346071d52f2b12802af42236af69b362f2f9d9d
(cherry picked from commit 4f1fe6ead349a42db73ca53334831d34b719d332)

subject: [Queens] Don't stop docker on config changes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-09-11 12:48:40.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/docker.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/78358da44f37cd455421677d5b123668bc2efa33', 'message': "[Queens] Don't stop docker on config changes

This will allow us to take advantage of the Docker live restore
option, and not restart all containers during minor update on small
docker config changes. The containers will be restarted only in case
Docker RPM is updated during the minor update.

If we ship a config change which wouldn't work well with live restore,
we'll need to re-enable the restarts on config change. Docker
documentation does not specify which config options are safe to change
and which aren't.

Change-Id: I97cd28a7e1dfc1bec943754fbf42519b6f563da6
Closes-Bug: #1777146
"}]
commit_message:
[Queens] Don't stop docker on config changes

This will allow us to take advantage of the Docker live restore
option, and not restart all containers during minor update on small
docker config changes. The containers will be restarted only in case
Docker RPM is updated during the minor update.

If we ship a config change which wouldn't work well with live restore,
we'll need to re-enable the restarts on config change. Docker
documentation does not specify which config options are safe to change
and which aren't.

Change-Id: I97cd28a7e1dfc1bec943754fbf42519b6f563da6
Closes-Bug: #1777146

subject: Disable external plugins in rabbitmq container
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-09-09 13:45:22.000000000', 'files': ['container-images/tripleo_kolla_template_overrides.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common/commit/5ca991aba3b80d4d037c7d292ddc9d7762a67f0a', 'message': 'Disable external plugins in rabbitmq container

We are doing this in the rabbit kolla container in tripleo:
{% block rabbitmq_install_plugins %}

RUN rm -rf /var/lib/rabbitmq/* \
    && ln -s /usr/lib/rabbitmq/lib/rabbitmq_server-3.6.* /usr/lib/rabbitmq/lib/rabbitmq_server-3.6 \
    && curl -o /usr/lib/rabbitmq/lib/rabbitmq_server-3.6/plugins/rabbitmq_clusterer-3.6.x-667f92b0.ez http://www.rabbitmq.com/community-plugins/v3.6.x/rabbitmq_clusterer-3.6.x-667f92b0.ez \
    && /usr/lib/rabbitmq/bin/rabbitmq-plugins enable --offline \
       rabbitmq_management \
       rabbitmq_clusterer

{% endblock %}

We should disable this as:
a) this is unwanted
b) we want to use only plugins shipped with rpm
c) we do not use those two plugins anyway

We do this by simply overriding the "rabbitmq_install_plugins" to a
comment.

Change-Id: I14f0f778d21b0d2a27d6e02468dac2cc1c8f25f7
Closes-Bug: #1791077
(cherry picked from commit 699d5002ccf43f8f20594116b9e5e0ea3b2d6d18)
'}]
commit_message:
Disable external plugins in rabbitmq container

We are doing this in the rabbit kolla container in tripleo:
{% block rabbitmq_install_plugins %}

RUN rm -rf /var/lib/rabbitmq/* \
    && ln -s /usr/lib/rabbitmq/lib/rabbitmq_server-3.6.* /usr/lib/rabbitmq/lib/rabbitmq_server-3.6 \
    && curl -o /usr/lib/rabbitmq/lib/rabbitmq_server-3.6/plugins/rabbitmq_clusterer-3.6.x-667f92b0.ez http://www.rabbitmq.com/community-plugins/v3.6.x/rabbitmq_clusterer-3.6.x-667f92b0.ez \
    && /usr/lib/rabbitmq/bin/rabbitmq-plugins enable --offline \
       rabbitmq_management \
       rabbitmq_clusterer

{% endblock %}

We should disable this as:
a) this is unwanted
b) we want to use only plugins shipped with rpm
c) we do not use those two plugins anyway

We do this by simply overriding the "rabbitmq_install_plugins" to a
comment.

Change-Id: I14f0f778d21b0d2a27d6e02468dac2cc1c8f25f7
Closes-Bug: #1791077
(cherry picked from commit 699d5002ccf43f8f20594116b9e5e0ea3b2d6d18)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/74/601074/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% block rabbitmq_install_plugins %} # External rabbitmq plugins installation is disabled {% endblock %}

commit_message:
Fix 'project purge' deleting wrong project's servers and volumes

Project purge would delete the servers and volumes for the project the
user is currently authenticated for, regardless of the --project flag.

Note: This change means that no server at all will be deleted if the
logged in user doesn't have the get_all_tenants permission set in the
Nova policy (default: admin_api). This doesn't appear to be an issue
with Cinder as the default rule appears to be admin_or_owner.

Change-Id: If1c54e24e1482438b81c3c32fd5fc9fdd7a7be04
Story: 1747988
Task: 13854

commit_message:
[Fullstack] Mark securitygroups tests as unstable

It agains fails quite often in iptables scenarios.
We need to debug it more to find out what cause this issue
but for now let's mark this test as unstable to make
life of other people easier.

Change-Id: I7bf6f9b346c6c853193cb045fb364b97375e9d93
Related-bug: #1779328

commit_message:
Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'ssl' job, given that the person working on
   that is no longer doing so, and no-one else has picked up
   the work.
2. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it.

Change-Id: I28ff7b95d3b2cc064c59c9966e9c25c7ad9184da

commit_message:
Upgrade pip/setuptools/wheel in role test venv

In the integrated build, the repo build process upgrades
pip/setuptools/wheel in the venv to our preferred pinned
version, but the role tests using developer mode does not.

Gnocchi, since 4.3.0 [1] requires setuptools > 30.3.0 -
but CentOS only has 28.8.0 when it builds the venv, so the
package install fails.

In this patch we create the venv, then upgrade pip,
setuptools and wheel, then install the keystone packages.

Doing this for all roles is impractical, but it will be
necessary to unblock patches from merging into this role
today. In the future when we use the python_venv_build role
we can do all this there instead of repeating this patch
across all the roles.

[1] https://github.com/gnocchixyz/gnocchi/commit/3f8a22a51bec3a60709bcbf26648c4fd6a66d2b8
Change-Id: Ibb5a068350b30f0d74ef26a55528527bd9e646a3
(cherry picked from commit ca0211a08ba362145ad4ed7be5404863dc02843c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_gnocchi refs/changes/84/602684/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix typo in ansible's module name.

Typo in ansible's module name causes issue during upgrade:
  "reason": "no action detected in task. This often indicates
  a misspelled module name, or incorrect module path.

Change-Id: Ia7accc61337464e5242eccbc0d385327de993c5f

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Idd86f02f30a9d7587dc62fc3e6a158410a03360b
Story: #2002586
Task: #24319

commit_message:
Make 'processutils' eventlet friendly in privsep daemon

This patch re-monkey-patch 'time' module in order to
make processutils library eventlet friendly. This patch
is related to [1].

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/593556/

Change-Id: I2a4c2ad6f07707dbc30653cd6cbc8191af4c4ed1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/61/593561/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import eventlet # NOTE(tommylikehu): Since privsep daemon will import this module and we # utilize 'oslo_concurrency.processutils' to execute commands, we need to # monkey patch the 'time' module here again in order to make # processutils eventlet friendly. eventlet.monkey_patch(time=True)

commit_message:
Change container image prepare logging in UC upgrade.

The container image prepare step run during
Undercloud upgrade is being logged in the same
file where the whole upgrade is being logged by
default. This patch changes the file location,
as well as the redirection in the ansible step
in charge of running tripleo-container-image-prepare.

Change-Id: I3c4437f31cf827ba190daad25a9af1970424408b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/95/599395/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix validation runs in a containerized environment

This fix addresses the following issues:
- No validations user present in the mistral-executor container
- The ssh_keys environment isn't initially created

Change-Id: I53078723b0995d6cd9590f119b28a7ca2b95dafd
Closes-Bug: #1789886

commit_message:
Add support for rbd_exclusive_cinder_pool

As of the of the queens release cinder supports this config
option which, if enabled, stops cinder from query all
volumes in a pool every time it does a delete in order to
get accurate pool usage stats. The problem is that this
causes tons of non-fatal race conditions and slows down deletes
to the point where the rpc thread pool fills up blocking
further requests. Our charms do not configure pool by default
and we are not aware of anyone doing this in the field so
this patch enables this option by default.

Change-Id: I5377e2886a6e206d30bd7dc38a7e43a085aa524c
Closes-Bug: 1789828
(cherry picked from commit b04b5f3b5f00f67eef2b76fbb5b64aba2b80719d)

commit_message:
Add support for cells v2

This change adds relations necessary for registering a compute cell
with the superconductor. For a cell to be registered this charm
must have relations with the compute cells conductor, database and
message queue. Only when all these relations are complete can the
registration happen. Below are major changes included in this PR.

* Add nova-cell-api relation for communicating with the
  nova-cell-conductor
* Add shared-db-cell relation for communicating with the
  a compute cells database.
* Add amqp-cell relation for communicating with the
  a compute cells message queue.
* Add methods for registering cells with the
  superconductors database.
* Charm helper sync

Change-Id: I9b9ac863920bd74607b8957a37c15df576d9637e

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-09-13 23:32:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops/commit/bd5b279461c0a65222eb119de9e893ffaa6c45c5', 'message': 'Converg the logstash pipelines

Pipeline setup has been added to the beat configurations.

Change-Id: Ie3c775f98b14f71bcbed05db9cb1c5aa46d9c436
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'number': 15, 'created': '2018-09-17 02:25:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops/commit/8c86e567c6a13374dfaa42e241efaab7051d7803', 'message': 'Converg the logstash pipelines and enhance memory backed queues

The multi-logstash pipeline setup, while amazingly fast, was crashing
and causing index errors when under high load for a long period of time.
Because of the crashing behavior and the fact that the folks from
Elastic describe multi-pipeline queues to be "beta" at this time the
logstash pipelines have been converted back into a single pipeline.

The memory backed queue options are now limited by a ram disk (tmpfs)
which will ensure that a burst within the queue does not cause OOM
issues and ensures a highly performant deployment and limiting memory
usage at the same time. Memory backed queues will be enabled when the
underlying system is using "rotational" media as detected by ansible
facts. This will ensure a fast and consistent experience across all
deployment types.

Pipeline/ml/template/dashboard setup has been added to the beat
configurations which will ensure beats are properly configured even
when running in an isolated deployment and outside of normal operations
where beats are generally configured on the first data node.

Change-Id: Ie3c775f98b14f71bcbed05db9cb1c5aa46d9c436
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'number': 16, 'created': '2018-09-17 03:42:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops/commit/ab3f726d1610675afb679755dc29fe37b41263d5', 'message': 'Converg the logstash pipelines and enhance memory backed queues

The multi-logstash pipeline setup, while amazingly fast, was crashing
and causing index errors when under high load for a long period of time.
Because of the crashing behavior and the fact that the folks from
Elastic describe multi-pipeline queues to be "beta" at this time the
logstash pipelines have been converted back into a single pipeline.

The memory backed queue options are now limited by a ram disk (tmpfs)

commit_message:
Converg the logstash pipelines and enhance memory backed queues

The multi-logstash pipeline setup, while amazingly fast, was crashing
and causing index errors when under high load for a long period of time.
Because of the crashing behavior and the fact that the folks from
Elastic describe multi-pipeline queues to be "beta" at this time the
logstash pipelines have been converted back into a single pipeline.

The memory backed queue options are now limited by a ram disk (tmpfs)
which will ensure that a burst within the queue does not cause OOM
issues and ensures a highly performant deployment and limiting memory
usage at the same time. Memory backed queues will be enabled when the
underlying system is using "rotational" media as detected by ansible
facts. This will ensure a fast and consistent experience across all
deployment types.

Pipeline/ml/template/dashboard setup has been added to the beat
configurations which will ensure beats are properly configured even
when running in an isolated deployment and outside of normal operations
where beats are generally configured on the first data node.

Change-Id: Ie3c775f98b14f71bcbed05db9cb1c5aa46d9c436
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Replace port and change version API for "www_authenticate_uri"

Arcording to [1], this patch replace port 35357 with 5000
and change version API v2.0 with v3 for "www_authenticate_uri"

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541857

Change-Id: I5e099e73cf9d2e1b7cc68f83bc3f4683773fbafa

commit_message:
Cannot update ssl certificate when update listener

Update listener success, but only the name and description of the
listener has been updated. Certificate remains same as old one.

Change-Id: I35aa3ca8d77f5cd58d8bd945fadc1061ecf05112
Closes-Bug: #1753656

subject: add caching to _build_regex_range
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-31 20:55:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/47dba50cd2fa170ff1388244ba5ddee4aeddb8f9', 'message': 'add caching to _build_regex_range

- _build_regex_range is called 17 time on
  import of nova.api.validation.parameters_types.
  _build_regex_range internally calls re.escape
  and valid_char  on every char returned
  form _get_all_chars.
  _get_all_chars yields all chars up to 0xffff.
  As a result re.escape and valid_char are called
  1.1 million time when
  nova.api.validation.parameters_types is imported.

- This change add a memorize decorator and uses
  it to cache _build_regex_range

- This change does not cache valid_char,
  _is_printable or re.escape as hashing and
  caching them for each invocation would
  be far more costly both in time and memory
  then computing the result.

Change-Id: Ic1f2c560a6da815b26fdf770450bbe439d18d4f9
Closes-Bug: #1790195
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-09-06 14:38:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/2068ada02604675b9786fabce24851138a148955', 'message': 'add caching to _build_regex_range

- _build_regex_range is called 17 time on
  import of nova.api.validation.parameters_types.
  _build_regex_range internally calls re.escape
  and valid_char  on every char returned
  form _get_all_chars.
  _get_all_chars yields all chars up to 0xffff.
  As a result re.escape and valid_char are called
  1.1 million time when
  nova.api.validation.parameters_types is imported.

- This change add a memorize decorator and uses
  it to cache _build_regex_range

- This change does not cache valid_char,
  _is_printable or re.escape as hashing and
  caching them for each invocation would
  be far more costly both in time and memory
  then computing the result.

Change-Id: Ic1f2c560a6da815b26fdf770450bbe439d18d4f9
Closes-Bug: #1790195
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2018-09-16 19:56:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/validation/parameter_types.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_api_validation.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/90b206894a2c442a5c475a3d90fff8f89a9b3ce0', 'message': 'add caching to _build_regex_range

- _build_regex_range is called 17 times on
  import of nova.api.validation.parameters_types.
  _build_regex_range internally calls re.escape
  and valid_char  on every char returned
  from _get_all_chars.
  _get_all_chars yields all chars up to 0xffff.
  As a result re.escape and valid_char are called
  1.1 million times when
  nova.api.validation.parameters_types is imported.

- This change add a memorize decorator and uses
  it to cache _build_regex_range

- This change does not cache valid_char,
  _is_printable or re.escape as hashing and
  caching them for each invocation would
  be far more costly both in time and memory
  than computing the result.

Change-Id: Ic1f2c560a6da815b26fdf770450bbe439d18d4f9
Closes-Bug: #1790195
'}]
commit_message:
add caching to _build_regex_range

- _build_regex_range is called 17 times on
  import of nova.api.validation.parameters_types.
  _build_regex_range internally calls re.escape
  and valid_char  on every char returned
  from _get_all_chars.
  _get_all_chars yields all chars up to 0xffff.
  As a result re.escape and valid_char are called
  1.1 million times when
  nova.api.validation.parameters_types is imported.

- This change add a memorize decorator and uses
  it to cache _build_regex_range

- This change does not cache valid_char,
  _is_printable or re.escape as hashing and
  caching them for each invocation would
  be far more costly both in time and memory
  than computing the result.

Change-Id: Ic1f2c560a6da815b26fdf770450bbe439d18d4f9
Closes-Bug: #1790195
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/71/599071/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parameter_types._reset_cache()

commit_message:
Move Shaker jobs to project repository

Similar to official projects almost all of Zuul configuration is moved
to project repo. The only remaining job is publish-to-pypy [1].

Corresponding import patch is already merged into shaker repo [2].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/creators.html#central-config-exceptions
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/601960/

Change-Id: Ia94474d0d0342f2fcd2edb3a9f86c1a93f524c57

commit_message:
Rename changes-since test sample file

In the past, we only have changes-since filter, we called it as
timestamp-filter, but now we will add a changes-before filter,
the timestamp-filter is not clear anymore.

In this patch, we rename timestamp to changes-since.

Change-Id: Ieee912e197d17a5ffca7460f3b977316cd21813e

subject: ovsdb monitor: do not die on ovsdb-client stderr output
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-08-27 13:20:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/efb4f15ac9747d0239d8899fdabed208df64a8d9', 'message': 'ovsdb monitor: do not die on ovsdb-client stderr output

That process may generate stderr output (ovs 2.10 with dpdk support will
log about missing optional libraries for example), in which case the
agent will loop forever respawning the ovsdb-client processes.

AsyncProcess already handles processes exiting uncleanly, and logs
stderr output with log_output=True (which is the case for OvsdbMonitor).

As the monitors work on stdout output, disabling die_on_error is enough
to make them work with this behaviour.

commit_message:
ovsdb monitor: do not die on ovsdb-client stderr output

That process may generate stderr output (ovs 2.10 with dpdk support will
log about missing optional libraries for example), in which case the
agent will loop forever respawning the ovsdb-client processes.

AsyncProcess already handles processes exiting uncleanly, and logs
stderr output with log_output=True (which is the case for OvsdbMonitor).

As the monitors work on stdout output, disabling die_on_error is enough
to make them work with this behaviour.

Change-Id: I8f2e5b93b9c16f9b288046911b5aeb4938845233
Closes-Bug: #1788865
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/17/596717/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: die_on_error=False)

subject: Disable sync_power_state_interval in containerized undercloud
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-09-12 14:16:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/1f57c33ba65928b69b8b214a367070b21cb0514b', 'message': 'Disable sync_power_state_interval in containerized undercloud

On the non containerized undercloud we had the following snippet:
"""
nova_config {
  'DEFAULT/sync_power_state_interval': value => hiera('nova_sync_power_state_interval');
}

nova_sync_power_state_interval: -1
"""
The reasons for which were described in: https://launchpad.net/bugs/1552842.
This setting has been lost when we moved to containerized undercloud.
Let's add a new NovaSyncPowerStateInterval parameter that is set to 0
(meaning uses the default) and set it to -1 on the undercloud.

With this patch we have on the undercloud:

commit_message:
Disable sync_power_state_interval in containerized undercloud

On the non containerized undercloud we had the following snippet:
"""
nova_config {
  'DEFAULT/sync_power_state_interval': value => hiera('nova_sync_power_state_interval');
}

nova_sync_power_state_interval: -1
"""
The reasons for which were described in: https://launchpad.net/bugs/1552842.
This setting has been lost when we moved to containerized undercloud.
Let's add a new NovaSyncPowerStateInterval parameter that is set to 0
(meaning uses the default) and set it to -1 on the undercloud.

With this patch we have on the undercloud:
undercloud: http://logs.openstack.org/23/599423/1/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-undercloud-containers/73a1323/logs/undercloud/var/log/config-data/nova/etc/nova/nova.conf.txt.gz:
sync_power_state_interval=-1

And on the overcloud:
https://logs.rdoproject.org/23/599423/1/openstack-check/legacy-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-3ctlr_1comp-featureset001-master/d372ea8/logs/overcloud-controller-0/var/log/config-data/nova/etc/nova/nova.conf.txt.gz
sync_power_state_interval=0

Reported-By: Marian Krcmari <mkrcmari@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>

Depends-On: Ie82d88f16b42d4405853153460e20f38ba42714a

Change-Id: Ifc817ba77187d454c24090c93461b1edad9fe7c4
Closes-Bug: #1790504
(cherry picked from commit 0be27ee963e32724dfb3de0eee0ff22983025682)

commit_message:
Resolve cinder config deprecation warnings

The change removes or updates options that have been changed in the
cinder.conf file and are throwing deprecation warnings in the logs.

Change-Id: Ib5a128e82e5251077e341b5f428eb097bcc17590
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Link to the in-tree driver support matrix from multiattach docs

The in-tree driver support matrix supersedes the potentially
stale driver support matrix wiki, so this updates the admin
docs for multiattach to point at the former rather than the
latter.

Change-Id: I7bf909e68eb14de4d56d4ab62e5e48abf3d40616

commit_message:
Improve get-pip.py reliability

Currently the output from curl is redirected to a file,
regardless of whether the request succeeded or not.

This patch adds:

--output
to direct the output to a file without using bash
redirection

--fail
to ensure that curl returns a non-zero error code if
the request returns a 503

Change-Id: Ic811d89fb6e73d341dfe6238f965b0b873307aff
(cherry picked from commit fcbb63dc886676e3adf8e70e64c867ac8e93b930)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/84/602884/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: GETPIP_CMD="curl --fail --silent --show-error --retry 5 --output ${GETPIP_FILE}" ${GETPIP_CMD} ${GET_PIP_URL} ${GETPIP_CMD} https://bootstrap.pypa.io/3.3/get-pip.py \ || ${GETPIP_CMD} https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pypa/get-pip/master/3.3/get-pip.py

commit_message:
Release openstackdocstheme 1.24.0

- If you use storyboard via ``use_storyboard``, now only ``repository_name``
is used and not ``bug_project`` anymore to construct the URL for storyboard.

- Fix the generated URL.

- Fix the project-navigator link

Change-Id: Ibc70432d72c00f4e15606a8faf55b6c5ab9e1d0e

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I9476682c19bf4b1ff9db069857f92999f5d8df95
Story: #2002586
Task: #24288

commit_message:
Rename SUSE vars file to cater for any version

To make the transition between versions easier,
we rename the vars file. This also resolves
issues when meta-dependent role inclusions do
not pick up the correct file when using the
include_vars task with multiple search paths.

We also add the 'python-cursive' package to the
distro install package list as cinder requires
it, and the service packages have not yet got
it as a dependency in the spec.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/602924
Change-Id: Ibb712b60757cf085cf794551ca5504e68977cd0a

commit_message:
use include_tasks instead of include

include is marked as deprecated since ansible 2.4[0]

Switch to include_tasks or import_playbook as necessary

[0] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/2.4/include_module.html#deprecated

Change-Id: I283ed3badf57e8ad66de3e49b5ae3d3ab411d54c
Closes-Bug: #1792761

commit_message:
Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'ssl' job, given that the person working on
   that is no longer doing so, and no-one else has picked up
   the work.
2. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it.
3. We promote the distro_install jobs, given that they are
   all now working.
4. We promote the centos apache/uwsgi functional test, given
   that it is working consistently.

Change-Id: I67e0d8f4ab52449a80adb5c479faefbc83617025
(cherry picked from commit 4238d5a4f4705d8ca26d38becf0e8d2fa5f95c5f)
